intro: Epidendrum auritum, commonly known as the ear-shaped orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It features long, arching stems that bear clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers with distinctive auricle-like appendages on the petals. The plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Epidendrum auritum is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
